title: How to Set Calendar Notifications on iPhone

steps.title: Open the Calendar app on your iPhone.
steps.content: Open the Calendar app on your iPhone. You can set up notifications for the events or appointments you add to your Calendar. [1] X Research source You'll find the Calendar app on your home screen or in your App Library. The notification alerts you add to your calendar on your iPhone or iPad will also work across all of your Apple devices, including your Mac.

steps.title: Tap the calendar event for which you want to set a reminder.
steps.content: Tap the calendar event for which you want to set a reminder. [2] X Research source This opens a brief summary of the event. If a reminder is already set, you'll see it (e.g., "15 minutes before") next to "Alert" on this screen. If no reminder is set, you'll see "None." If you want to create a new calendar event and set a reminder, tap + at the top-right to create an event instead.

steps.title: Tap Edit.
steps.content: Tap Edit . This opens the event for editing. [3] X Research source If you're creating a new event, just enter the info for your event, including the name, date, location, and other pertinent information.

steps.title: Tap Alert.
steps.content: Tap Alert . It's toward the bottom of the event details. You'll see this option whether you're editing an existing reminder or creating a new one. You'll be able to create two reminders for a single event. This is helpful if you want to be reminded before the event and at the time the event begins.

steps.title: Choose when you want to see a reminder.
steps.content: Choose when you want to see a reminder. You can have the Calendar app remind you of an event before it begins or right at its start time. Select an option, such as 2 days before or 30 minutes before . Once selected, a reminder will be set. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Tap Second alert to add another reminder (optional).
steps.content: Tap Second alert to add another reminder (optional). If you want to set a second reminder, you can select another time here. For example, you can choose At the time of event if you want this reminder to appear on the screen right when the event or appointment begins.

steps.title: Tap Done to save your event.
steps.content: Tap Done to save your event. Now that you've set a reminder, you'll be notified of the event at the time you chose. If you added an address to your event, your iPhone will also give you an automatic reminder when it's time to leave. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Change the default reminder time for new events (optional).
steps.content: Change the default reminder time for new events (optional). You can make a quick change in your Calendar settings that makes all new events have reminders set by default. You'll still be able to change the reminder time for each event. Here's how to change your default reminder time: Open your iPhone's Settings . Scroll down and tap Calendar . Tap Default Alert Times . Tap Events . Select a default reminder time.

steps.title: Open your iPhone's Settings .
steps.content: Open your iPhone's Settings . If you want to change the look or sound of the notifications you receive for Calendar reminders, it's easy to do. Tap the gray gear icon on your Home screen or in your App Library to get started.

steps.title: Tap Notifications.
steps.content: Tap Notifications . This is in the second group of settings.

steps.title: Tap Calendar.
steps.content: Tap Calendar . Now you'll see all of your alert options for your calendar. If the "Allow Notifications" switch is gray or white, tap the switch to turn on notifications—the switch will turn green.

steps.title: Choose where to display your reminders.
steps.content: Choose where to display your reminders. By default, you'll see notifications for your event on the lock screen, in the notification center, and as a pop-up banner. Tap the checkmarks below each option to toggle the reminder type on or off.

steps.title: Tap Sounds to change the reminder tone.
steps.content: Tap Sounds to change the reminder tone. This is also under the "Alerts" header.

steps.title: Select the sound you want to hear for calendar reminders.
steps.content: Select the sound you want to hear for calendar reminders. If you want, you can also tap Vibration at the top to customize the vibration pattern. Selecting a sound changes the reminder tone for your Calendar to that sound.

steps.title: Ask Siri to set a reminder (optional).
steps.content: Ask Siri to set a reminder (optional). When you ask Siri to remind you of something, Siri adds the reminder to the Reminders app. For example, if you say, "Hey Siri, remind me to pick up my dry-cleaning at 4:30," Siri will makes sure you're notified at that time. But these reminders will not appear in the Calendar app—just in your iPhone's Reminders app. It's as simple as that! The Reminders app is geared toward reminders for things like To-Do lists, home projects, and other tasks that you don't need to add to the Calendar app. Reminders you create in the Reminders app do not appear on your Calendar, but you will be able to access them on all Apple devices (including your Mac) on which you're using the Reminders app. Read on to learn how to create a reminder in the Reminders app without Siri.

steps.title: Open the Reminders app on your iPhone.
steps.content: Open the Reminders app on your iPhone. It has a white icon with a colorful bulleted list. You'll find it on the Home screen or in your App Library.

steps.title: Tap + New Reminder.
steps.content: Tap + New Reminder . It's at the bottom-left corner. This opens the New Reminder screen.

steps.title: Enter the name and a note about your reminder.
steps.content: Enter the name and a note about your reminder. The "Notes" part is optional, but could be helpful for supplemental info you might need at the time you'll get the reminder.

steps.title: Tap Details.
steps.content: Tap Details . It's toward the bottom of the screen.

steps.title: Enter the date and time of your reminder.
steps.content: Enter the date and time of your reminder. Although you can select the date of your reminder from a calendar, the reminder will still not appear in the Calendar app. You can also enter a location that will appear when you receive the reminder. To set a reminder priority, tap the Priority option. Tap the back button when you're finished.

steps.title: Tap Add.
steps.content: Tap Add . It's at the top-right corner. This creates your reminder. You'll receive an alert on the specified time and date.

steps.title: Mark a reminder as completed.
steps.content: Mark a reminder as completed. When you receive the reminder and complete the associated task, you can tap the empty circle next to the reminder's name and mark it as complete. [6] X Research source Alternatively, you can swipe left on the reminder and select Delete if you want to completely remove it from the app.
